title: new warnings about the contents of the archive
body:
Looks like Spack started to falsely report warnings about the tarbals. Happens for `openmpi`, `boost`, `xz`, `hwloc`, `expat` and maybe others.

### Expected Result

no warnigs

### Actual Result

```
==> Installing openmpi
==> Fetching http://www.open-mpi.org/software/ompi/v3.0/downloads/openmpi-3.0.0.tar.bz2
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Warning: The contents of
  the archive
   look like HTML.
  The checksum will likely be bad.  If it is, you can use
  'spack clean <package>' to remove the bad archive, then
  fix your internet gateway issue and install again.
==> Staging archive: /spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.0.0-qj2jvimfe4js4w5od2xkctlwln7kisja/openmpi-3.0.0.tar.bz2
==> Created stage in /spack/var/spack/stage/openmpi-3.0.0-qj2jvimfe4js4w5od2xkctlwln7kisja
==> No patches needed for openmpi
==> Building openmpi [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Successfully installed openmpi
  Fetch: 3.37s.  Build: 19m 0.53s.  Total: 19m 3.91s.
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install openmpi
```

### Information on your system

macOS 10.13.1
